--------------------
Text: Nothing Has Changed (also titled Nothing Has Changed: The Very Best of David Bowie) is a compilation album by English musician David Bowie.
Triplets:<Nothing Has Changed
The Very Best of David Bowie
1:
--------------------
Text: Nothing Has Changed:  It was released on 18 November 2014 through Parlophone in the United Kingdom, and Columbia Records and Legacy Recordings in the United States.
Triplets:<Nothing Has Changed
2:
--------------------
Text: Nothing Has Changed:  It is the first album to showcase Bowie's entire career and includes a new composition, "Sue (Or in a Season of Crime)", which was later re-recorded for his final album "Blackstar" (stylized as ★) (2016).
Triplets:<Nothing Has Changed
3:
--------------------
Text: Nothing Has Changed:  "Nothing Has Changed" is notable for including songs from Bowie's unreleased 2001 album "Toy": "Your Turn to Drive", previously an internet-only single, and a previously unreleased re-recorded version of "Let Me Sleep Beside You", both of which are found on the triple CD version of the album.

Triplets:<Nothing Has Changed
4:
--------------------
Text: Nothing Has Changed:  The album's title comes from a lyric in the song "Sunday" from Bowie's album "Heathen" (2002).
